intro: Oxytropis lutchensis, commonly known as the Lutchenskaya oxytropis, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Oxytropis lutchensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
